This week the Kentucky General Assembly is set to move forward some of the most extreme anti-abortion legislation in the country.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Two pieces of anti-abortion legislation are on the move this week in the Kentucky General Assembly and we need you to call your legislators today to ask for their NO votes.

House Bill 148 is scheduled to be heard in committee today. The bill will outlaw abortion in Kentucky if Roe v. Wade is ever overturned.

Senate Bill 9, the 6-week abortion ban, is to be heard in committee this Thursday morning. This unconstitutional abortion ban is the latest extreme step by Kentucky politicians to put abortion care out of reach in the commonwealth. If passed, it would be one of the most restrictive abortion bans in the entire country.

At this time, a phone message is one of the most important ways to reach your legislators on these bills. Call 1-800-372-7181. All you have to know is your address and the dispatchers will send your message to your legislators. Say that you want them to vote NO on House Bill 148 and Senate Bill 9. Your call should take no longer than two-minutes.

Thank you for taking this emergency action to protect reproductive freedom in the Commonwealth. Both of these bills are on the fast track to passage and could move out of their respective bodies by the end of the week. Please call today.

Thanks for sticking with us,

ACLU of Kentucky
